maqras.text: Say, “The angel of death, who is entrusted with you, will take you back (cause you to die), then to your Fosterer you will be returned.”

And if you (could only) see, when the criminals would bow down their heads before their Fosterer (pleading), “Our Fosterer! we have seen and heard, so send us back we will do righteous work, (now) we are certain.”
And had We willed We could have guided every soul, but the word from Me that, “I will fill hell with the jinn and human beings together,” will be (proved) true
So taste (the punishment), because you forgot the meeting of this day of yours We (too) will forget you. And taste the everlasting punishment because of that which you used to do
Only those believe in Our signs who, when they are reminded through them, fall down prostrate and glorify by praising their Fosterer and they do not consider themselves great
Their sides keep away from their beds, they pray to their Fosterer in fear and in hope and they spend from that which We have provided them
So no soul knows what is hidden from it, of (that which) comforts the eye, (as a) reward for that which they used to do
Then, is he who is a believer, like him who is a transgressor? They are not equal
As for those who believe and do righteous works, for them are gardens as (their) settling place, a gift for what they used to do

And as for those who transgress, their settling place is the fire, whenever they will intend to come out of it, they will be returned into it and it will be said to them, “Taste the punishment of the fire which you used to deny.”
And We will definitely make them taste (something) from a nearer punishment besides the greater punishment, that they may return
And who is more unjust than one who is reminded through the signs of his Fosterer, then he turns away from them? We will definitely inflict retribution on the criminals
And We indeed gave the book to Musa, so do not be in doubt about his receiving it, and We made it a guide for the children of Israel
And when they were patient and they had certainty in Our signs, We made from among them leaders who guided by Our command
Your Fosterer will certainly decide between them on the day of resurrection, concerning that wherein they used to differ
I s it not (enough) for their guidance: How many of the generations before them did We destroy, in whose dwelling places they walk? Certainly there are signs in that. Will they not then hear
Did they not see that We drive the water to the barren earth, then We bring out vegetation from it, from which their cattle and they themselves eat, will they not then see
And they say, “When will this judgment be if you are truthful?”
Say, “On the day of judgment, the believing of those who had not believed (earlier) will not benefit them, and they will not be given time (for amendment).”
So keep away from them and wait, they (too) are certainly waiting
